snippet.title: Shamus - (1983) - C64 - WIN!
snippet.description:
➨ Follow me on Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/vghchannel/ 
➨ Donate: http://paypal.me/vghchannel
 ⇩  Click "SHOW MORE" for details and review

Synapse Software Corporation © 1983 
[Computer] Commodore 64
Emulator:  WinVice Core via RetroArch
Rating: 7/10

Shamus (Case 1)… This game really grabbed me when I first came across it on the C64.  It was fun, much like Berzerk… but more of a quest, and with quicker gameplay.  I eventually got lost in the mazes… probably needed to map them out, but didn't ever want to  - just wanted to run & shoot.  Difficulty ramps up, too, making it hard to win.  So, I decided it was time to revisit the game for the good ol' Commodore 64 and BEAT IT.  

 I have to report the Atari 8-bit IS probably the definitive edition… however, its still really fun to try other ports.  C64 is a good one.

C64 - This was the version I discovered as a teen.  Excellent sounds, great gameplay.  A little more "gridlike" than the Atari 8-bit… so felt a little harder overall.  For the ending -- it did add a longer scrolling text message.  "Congratulations you won" and then a long text scroll written by a teenager or something.  It was strange, but at least they added something new to the end.  

Unfortunately, even in the highest difficulty (expert) it's the same silly ending.  But this game is totally worth playing.
